body.name: Baby Jogger® City Tour™ 2 Ultra-Compact Travel Stroller, Pike
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tomorrow, February 17. Order within 3 hrs 53 mins
features: Ultra-lightweight travel stroller weighs only 14 lb, with a compact and easy-to-maneuver design
Create a travel system by adding a Baby Jogger infant car seat using adapters (car seat and adapters sold separately)
Ultra-compact, one-step fold and auto-lock ensures easy transportation and storage
Multi-position padded seat reclines to a near-flat position, and adjustable calf support provides comfort for growing children
Includes s a carry bag to protect stroller from dirt and scratches when traveling
Premium leatherette-covered handle and an included belly bar provide an added touch of style
Enhanced with upgraded fabrics that offer a soft, textured feel you and your baby will love
body.description: The Baby Jogger® City Tour™ 2, Pike, folds up small for big adventures—85% smaller than when it's unfolded. The City Tour™ 2 is the ultimate stroller for travel, with an ultra-compact, one-step fold, a weight of only 14 lb, and includes both a carry bag and a belly bar. But despite its lightness, the City Tour™ 2 doesn't skimp on features. Baby rides comfortably with multiple recline positions, adjustable calf support, a UV 50+ canopy, and a comfortable padded seat with added depth. Premium touches like the leatherette-covered handle and soft, textured fabrics provide an elevated look and feel both you and baby will love. The infant car seat connection with the City Tour™ 2 lets you and baby travel together from infancy. Pair your City Tour™ 2 with any Baby Jogger® infant car seat for a smooth and serene ride for babies up to 20 lb (infant car seat sold separately). Choose from plenty of add-on accessories (sold separately) to customize the stroller for the comfort and convenience of both parent and child. With the City Tour™ 2, you're fully equipped to carry on with your day, wherever it may lead you.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: The Perfect Stroller For: Convenience on the go with a fast and compact one-step foldA lightweight option for every journey at only 14 lbBaby's comfort with padded, reclining seat & adjustable calf supportAdaptability from infancy through age 5Large basket holds up to 15 lb Baby Jogger City Tour 2 Ultra-Compact Travel Stroller Travel in style from day one The Baby Jogger City Tour 2 is the ultimate stroller for travel, with an ultra-compact, one-hand fold, a weight of only 14 lb, and an included carry bag. But despite its lightness, the City Tour 2 doesn't skimp on features. Baby rides comfortably in a padded seat with multiple recline positions, adjustable calf support, and a UV 50+ canopy. Pair with any Baby Jogger infant car seat (sold separately) for a smooth and serene ride from infancy. *We recommend checking with your local airline prior to departure for specific carry-on requirements.

Everything You'll Need for a Quick Getaway First-Class Comfort Baby will enjoy a smooth ride, complete with a multi-position padded seat that reclines to a near-flat position and adjustable calf support. This Baby Moves! Because it's only 14 lb, the City Tour 2 makes a great travel companion that is portable and easy to maneuver. Around the World or the Block Durable, lightweight tires provide a smooth ride throughout your journey. Or lock the front-swivel wheels when you're ready for a break. Stow Your Bags Or anything else! The large under-seat storage basket can hold up to 15 lb, so you can stash everything you'll need and still have room for souvenirs.

All the Comforts You Expect from Baby Jogger Go Baby, Go Get going from day 1, as the City Tour 2 easily pairs with any Baby Jogger infant car seat (sold separately). Travel-Sized Easily folds down to an ultra-compact size for convenient storage, and includes a carry bag to keep your stroller looking great throughout your travels. Room with a View The large UV 50+ canopy features an extension panel as well as a peekaboo window so you can easily check in.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A new favorite
reviews.reviewText: We bought this used and had no issues with quality, set up or anything like that. This takes up like no space in the trunk, super easy to unfold and pop into space. We took this on a trip to Dallas with our 2 year old and it was great to have since it folded/unfolded so quickly as we got on and off the plane (We did airside check it with the tag). It sits up and lays back and super smooth to use/ride.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to maneuver
reviews.reviewText: This stroller is awesome! We got it for an international trip coming up and we might want it to replace our regular stroller. Baby can't give a review but it looks more comfortable especially with the foot rest that can be elevated. The material is good and sturdy. It isn't too slippery like our other stroller so he isn't going to slide all over the place and somehow our of the seat. The straps are sturdy. I really like how it has a big buckle and a wide strap for the bottom strap that goes between the legs. The recline is near flat almost like laying in a recliner couch/chair. I wish that the canopy was a little bigger for more sun protection but it will do. This is the first time that baby has fallen asleep in a stroller without crying and fussing. He looks so relaxed!It goes over bumps and rough terrain easily but it can be a bumpy ride. Smaller wheels means less shock absorption. The stroller is pretty light so it is easy to tilt and go over larger bumps. It handles really well and can be steered with one hand (coffee in the other hand).It is a little more complicated to fold. It is rather difficult to fold and unfold with one hand but two hands is easy! It doesn't stay folded up unless you hold it by the carrier strap in the middle. It comes with a carrying bag, too! It is pretty small so it doesn't take up much space at all in the car and hopefully on an airplane, too.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Super compact fold, folds to size of a briefcase and easily fits in overhead bin of plane !! The plane staff were skeptical and surprised when we folded it in front of them (they were trying to make us gate check it). I even opened it on the plane on the way out and it was skinny enough to go in the aisle! This was a game changer for travel. Also leans back almost fully flat so baby can sleep. My 1 year old napped comfortably for hours at a time in this.The only complaint I have is the fold mechanism is pretty clunky...not a one hand fold like our full size cybex. Kind of annoying and holds you up at the plane. But other than that it's PERFECT for travel and has made all the difference! Hubby and I don't know how we went without it (this was our 4th trip with baby and our first time using this stroller). Price point is not bad, I got it on sale for $230...not cheap but better than the $500 competitor than doesn't even lie flat. 100% recommend

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So far so good.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this stroller for my currently 7 months old baby. We have the Chicco Bravo, and even though we love it because it's big and comfy, it takes up the entire trunk in our suv, it’s heavy, bulky and won’t fit in a plane cabin. I researched for a while and decided to give the baby jogger a try. An easy to fold, small to bring in cabin and sturdy stroller were a must since we plan on traveling by plane very often, plus we also want it for everyday use. Pros: FOOTREST! Our big full size stroller doesn’t have this, and it’s a must for taking naps. It’s easy to fold, and folds very small which is impressive. It came fully assembled and just had to put in the wheels which took me less than 30 seconds. I like the almost flat recline back rest. When pushing, it feels very lightweight compared to my big stroller. People have complained about the harness, but all the pieces came together and don’t detach easily so that’s fast too. Cons: basket is VERY small, but it’s a travel stroller so that’s understandable. On our big stroller we have a large basket where we can fit 2 backpacks but I believe this one can only hold a small purse. The canopy could be larger because the sun hits directly on baby’s chest.I’ll be using it for a couple months before we travel and I’ll edit the review if necessary.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Purchased for trip to Paris
reviews.reviewText: Overall this worked well for us and is much more compact than our old stroller. The folding was nice and relatively easy to carry, while it is light it does get heavy after a while. You do need two hands to fold up and close securely. The cargo carrier suited us and carried a small backpack and multiple packable coats. Three things I disliked, 1. it feels a bit flimsy, especially when going over bumpy roads it felt like it would fold up/bend the frame when trying to go over a bump. 2. The bag carrier while a great idea the one that comes with it is not great. I will be looking for another that has backpack straps and ideally wouldn’t need two people to get the stroller in the bag. 3. Lastly, if you have anything hanging on the back handle the stroller will tip over as soon as a kid leaves seat. Small issues vs using a bigger stroller in the small spaces in Europe or no stiller at all.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Saved our LIVES on a big international family trip!
reviews.reviewText: We were planning for a big international trip with our 1 year old and needed a super compact, maneuverable, sturdy stroller with some storage. The City Tour 2 exceeded all expectations - MVP of the trip! It did well on some tough streets. It fit well in every overhead compartment, which was a major criteria of ours. I would seriously recommend this stroller to anyone looking for a compact carry on stroller for travel of any sort.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I’ve been looking for a lightweight l, compact and also affordable stroller for a long time. I purchased one prior this one (mompush) which had great reviews but it wasn’t good at all for me. Finally I found what I was looking for in THIS stroller, plus the designs is absolutely beautiful. Not to mention that is so easy to maneuver that makes my life so easy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for storage and travel
reviews.reviewText: Holy moly this is compact! Moving from a house to an apartment I needed to condense quite a lot and my old stroller (chicco viaro) was bulky in my truck and coat closet. This thing is super light weight and folds down small with a smooth glide for a ride. I think it’s more convenient than our old Uppababy Minu which is 3 times the price.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great travel stroller for the price
reviews.reviewText: This is the second time I've purchased this stroller as the first one was damaged going through customs (yes this can fit in an overhead compartment of an airplane). My wife and I liked this model so much we waited 3 months for it to come back into stock. Comparable options in both size and price point just didn't impress us. This stroller folds down very easily and is light weight but durable enough to handle every day use. In hindsight we would have only bought this model and not a full size stroller to use as our primary stroller.

La mejor carriola del mundo!!! Estoy super satisfecha con la compra, la usamos por primera vez en un viaje a USA a Disney, es muy practica comoda ligera y super facil de abrir y cerrar. No tuve problema para llevarla en el carry on del avion incluso en una ocasión la quisieron documentar por pensar que no cabia y les demostre lo compacta que era. Mi bebe super comoda, el espacio de la canastilla es bueno lo unico es que el canopy no cubre tanto pero nada que un accesorio no pueda solucionar! Ademas de todo lo mencionado es nomita y estetica no como otras carriolas de viaje. Plus se ve de muy buena calidad y resistente. Gira super bien, de muy buena suspencion y rodado! Simplemente perfecta.
Love it! My 1 year old and 3 year old enjoyed it. So comfy. And thank you for the fast shipment!

Was not a fan of this stroller - it came and was not worth $400. Yes, it was compact but it was nowhere near comfortable or suitable for our 15month old. His head was over the top of the back of the stroller. It was also not easy to unfold unlike its description of being easy to unfold one handed.

Love almost everything about the baby jogger - it glides smoothly on flat ground providing a comfortable ride for the child and easy manoeuvring for parents. The space is wide and long enough and the calf support is great. My toddler and 3month old baby took turns to ride on it and were able to sleep soundly and comfortably in it. The one hand folding requires some getting used to and is not as easy as they show it on video but unfolding it is a breeze. I did not like that it does not stand on it's own while folded - resulted in my baby jogger getting some scratches when it hits the floor.
